Reviews.Title: “Good value but teeny tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: kravmaguffin
Reviews.Content: I have business in the Financial district, so location wise this hotel is an ideal one for business travelers. I've stayed multiple times and the staff is helpful and friendly. Rooms are super tiny, on a par with typical NY rooms, but the prices are cheap for NY (I've had rooms just under $200/night here). Rooms is basically a bed, a tv and a bathroom. No room for anything else. Workout room is two treadmills and a bike. Breakfast is free and surpisingly decent. Only drawback is difficulty finding a cab; usually have to walk several blocks to find one. They have a limo service, but on my last trip the limo driver tried to overcharge me then pretended he couldn't speak English, so caveat emptor.

Reviews.Title: “Careful!”
Reviews.Author: Annapolis21403
Reviews.Content: Probably not a bad hotel, but avoid "C" floor at all costs. There is a very noisy ice machine in the hall. Also, this floor is below the ground floor.The bed was fine but the room was small. Mold in the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Good value...”
Reviews.Author: KRJ99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn Seaport/Financial District for a weekend get-away. The room was very clean and comfortable. Our room was on the 9th floor and had a balcony overlooking the river/South Street Seaport which was a nice surprise. The staff was just wonderful, everyone was very friendly and eager to help with anything we needed. The subway was just a short walk away, as were South Street Seaport and the World Trade Center. We had a wonderful weekend and will definitely stay in this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: roughitinerary
Reviews.Content: Staff were very friendly and helpful. We were on the 7th floor facing the street but heard very little traffic noise. Beds were comfortable, bathroom a good size. Free WIFI a bonus. Breakfast included in the price. Got a good deal on Booking.com. Ate at Squires Diner which was a 5 minute walk away. Fulton Street subway about 10 mins walk. Was only about 15 minutes by subway to Times Square. We bought the 7 day unlimited access metro pass for $29 at the station.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: jimbird94
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in 12 New York hotels and this one was by far the most friendly. Desk clerks, doorman, maids and helpers in the breakfast room were all great. Small rooms, which of course is expected in New York. Beds (as usual with Hampton) were very comfortable. Self parking across the street was only $20. Good location. Great stay. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price Decent Room and Location”
Reviews.Author: barbaraal
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in January 2012. I got a wonderful overnight rate for 2 queen bedded room. I was able to use lot with indoor parking for a cost of only $20 per 24 hrs. That alone is a good bargain. The rooms are narrow but nice. The check in staff were very friendly and helpful. We had breakfast and it was good. The fresh waffle was very good with bananas on top. Cereal, yogurt and egg omelets were good as well. Stayed at Millenium hilton last month and the breakfast wasnt better and way more expensive stay. We walked to Chinatown and had Joe Shanghai for dinner and was an easy walk to Chinatown, Also only 3 or so blocks from seaport and fulton st subway station. For the price and location it was really nice. Would stay here again in a heartbeat for a good price! Make sure to ask for higher floor for noise and it will be hard to be far from elevator since only 5 or so rooms per floor. Furthest from elevator will face another buildings wall andnot much sunlight FYI. 06 ending rooms are the worst since right facing elevators. just so you know

Reviews.Title: “Great location, price”
Reviews.Author: doris_marie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hampton Inn over Thanksgiving Day weekend. The hotel is located in a great location, a few blocks from two different subway stations and lots of restaurants, coffee, and shopping in the South Street Seaport area. Be prepared, the rooms are really small, but the value is worth it because of the location, and really, how much time will you spend in the room? I stayed with my family of four in a double room, and it was fine. The bathroom is big, the beds and pillows are comfy and the complementary breakfast is fantastic! Parking is across the street to leave your car. The staff is super friendly. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: jws16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property last night and couldn't have been happier. The room was larger than I expected for NYC and everything was clean and comfortable. The breakfast was very good as well. The location was superb. Several restaurants nearby and a grocery store very close too. We walked over to the 9/11 Memorial site and the Fulton Street subway stop is even closer. Most notably the service was outstanding. The young lady working at the desk this morning took care of everything from helping us with extra towels to making us feel very appreciated. Great location and great service - we'll be back. They also had a deal with a parking garage across the street for $20 a night. Can't beat that in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: heidi h
Reviews.Content: We needed a last minute hotel in Manhattan and were extremely surprised and pleased by this hotel. The rooms are small but recently remodeled and well appointed. We were given rooms on the 8th floor and each had a small terrace! The price was relatively reasonably for nyc and the staff went above and beyond, storing luggage, calling cabs and cars and just generally being friendly and helpful. It is within easy walking distance of shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: stillred51
Reviews.Content: We live 30 miles from NYC, but decided to spend a weekend in town. We originally wanted to stay in midtown, but this hotel right around the corner from the South Street Seaport was priced right and available. Definitely to be considered instead of midtown!! It's quiet, accessible to everything, and the staff could not do enough for us. Rooms are average size, beds are extremely comfortable, room was surprisingly quiet, and very CLEAN! When we returned one evening at 11 pm, the man at the desk asked if we would like some freshly made cookies! He made a batch and delivered them to our room at midnight!! YUM! The staff happily put our dinner leftovers in their frig, and they were cheerful, helpful, and courteous all the time. Hot tea and coffee are always available at no charge downstairs, as is a bowl of fruit (oranges and apples when we were there). The included breakfast was very adequate, just right to get us started for the day. We walked and took subways all weekend and got everywhere without a problem. We were warmly greeted each time we returned, and even the other guests were friendly and helpful. Definitely a great find. And I'm a New Yorker!!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here on every trip to NYC”
Reviews.Author: Diamond6_inPA
Reviews.Content: Great price, convenient location, friendly staff, nice breakfast. This is a great deal in NYC, convenient to everything you need. I can't imagine paying three times more to stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Pathfinder889
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small and dated but for the price it is not bad since the location is good. Make sure you get a room towards the back of the building and away from the elevators. The rooms are not brightly lit so you will feel like you're in one of those gangster movies.....

Reviews.Title: “It's a Definite No”
Reviews.Author: oli-business
Reviews.Content: I've probably stayed at all of the Hampton Inns / Hilton Garden Inns / Doubletrees in NYC and this one is the worse. It should not belong to the Hilton Family. The rooms are small, the A/C unit is VERY noisy, the Internet access is VERY VERY slow at all times and the staff is...absent! Also, I was unable to lock the windows of my room and my room didn't smell very good (housekeeping was not that great). And forget about the gym, it's useless. The location is not great as there is no subway at a reasonable walking distance. If you're in this area and can spend a little bit more on hotels, go to the Doubletree Financial District on Stone Street.

Reviews.Title: “Great NYC location for a reasonable (NYC) price”
Reviews.Author: SLJack
Reviews.Content: Although the room was very small, it was clean and most people don't travel to NYC to sit in their rooms. The location compensates hugely for the tiny room or the tiny breakfast area. It's walking distance to the downtown attractions and good restaurants and is near a subway for trips further out. This hotel consistently comes up in searches as one of the more reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GAAllieKat
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean, nice linens, new bathroom. A great location and very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Inside”
Reviews.Author: Chicago Flyer
Reviews.Content: Average room - desk in the room was pretty scratched up but free wireless access. Bathroom ceiling had large pieces of peeling paint. Bed was just okay. Could not hear an outside noise but wow, the doors closing in the hallway were very loud. Woke me up several times during the night. Too bad - I would have rated this a little higher if that was fixed. Only a few blocks to the Fulton subway station - good location near the Seaport market area. Was there for work, easy walk to Wall St.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: shario
Reviews.Content: I had hoped to book a nicer hotel via Hotwire or Priceline but NYC hotels have shot up in price since the last time we were there. The best rate I could find was for this hotel on the Hilton website ($199/night). Since we are HHonors members, we decided to go for it. When I was booking, I requested an early check-in since our plane landed at 7:00 a.m. We got to the hotel at about 8:00 a.m., and the desk clerk allowed us to immediately check in. We didn't even have to ask. He also told us to help ourselves to breakfast, which we technically weren't entitled to that day. We were so grateful for the early check-in so we could rest awhile before setting out. This attitude was typical of the staff. Every single staff member was always asking us if everything was okay, if we needed anything, wishing us a nice evening, and saying hello. The room is nothing fancy, but is more than adequate, and is actually large by New York standards. The TV has a lot of cable channels. The bed is very comfortable. There is a computer and printer in the lobby where you can print boarding passes. The location is excellent, because it is in between two subway stations (Fulton and Brooklyn Bridge), which allows you to easily go anywhere in the City. There are also restaurants, food carts, drug stores, and shopping in the neighborhood. Battery Park is a short walk away. Although I was initially disappointed that we weren't staying at a nicer hotel, it turned out that our experience at this hotel was one of the best out of the seven times we have been to New York City, and we would be very happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Put my mother up in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: cazsbt
Reviews.Content: This is a great, little hotel. I flew my mom up for a visit and didn't want her to sleep on my old pullout couch so I put her up here. It's right by our apartment. She loved it. She was very comfortable and the room was immaculate. I booked a few months in advance and got a great rate. I wouldn't hesitate to have her stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great rate, wonderful stay, and super staff!”
Reviews.Author: athomemom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in August. We chose the hotel for the nightly rate, Seaport location, and great parking rate. We were happy with every part of our stay! The hotel is in a perfect location to walk to the Seaport , Brooklyn Bridge, and Battery Park. The subway is just down the street. What was by far the best part of our stay was the wonderful hospitality by the staff. Every person we encountered in the hotel was so helpful and kind. The front desk was so full of information and suggestions. The night we arrived, the gentelman working even offered us some yogurts to take to the room for our young children. The rooms are large for NYC size and the doubles have 2 queen beds instead of 2 doubles as most hotels offer. The day we checked out we were able to store our luggage in a storage room while we spent the day in the city. The parking is $20 a day, just across the street, that is a fantastic rate! We would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianVacationer09
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from a five night stay at the Hampton Inn/Seaport. After reading some of the reviews I was a little apprehensive but no need to be at all. We arrived early in the day to a warm welcome by the friendly staff and since our room wasn't ready we were able to freshen up, leave our luggage and venture out. We we returned to the hotel and were greeted with another warm welcome and were given a room on the 3rd floor (305), it was very clean and had everything that we needed. The breakfast in the lobby was more than enough to get us started for the day. Also when we returned from a very busy day we were able to grab a cup of tea to take back to the room. Again we were always greeted by the friendly staff and were asked more than once if there was anything we needed. This was not our first visit to NYC so it was a nice change to be at a hotel away from the crowds in Times Square. The subway station was close and very easy to use. We had a wonderful trip to NYC and would not hesitate to stay at this Hampton Inn again. Wonderful staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gastly”
Reviews.Author: veronique26900
Reviews.Content: We had booked a room for 2 nights and were astonished to find out that not only the prepaid accomodation was not available, but that there was no ready plan to send us to an alternative hotel. We finally ended up next block, but only 2 out of 3 had a bed... Eventhough on their reception desk they have a phrase that garanties money back if one is not fully satisfied, 15 after the fact we still have to hear about them !!! We did get to spend our second night there (room ok), and in the morning it was a nightmare to try and get breakfast, for they have a breakfastroom smaller than most people's kitchen, and after nine they run out of foodstuff...

Reviews.Title: “better than hoped for”
Reviews.Author: Linda250
Reviews.Content: It's been decades since I've been to NYC - I didn't want to pay too much for a hotel room that I didn't expect to spend too much time in, and we were a party of three, which really shortened the list of options. We were so glad we ended up here! The staff was friendly and helpful for us. We had no trouble getting a room with 2 doubles, and by being on the 2nd floor, we could avoid the one pokey elevator. The breakfast was much more varied and plentiful than what I had expected, based on recent stays at a Best Western in a different city. But what i loved most of all about this hotel was the location: we got to see a part of NYC that we would not likely have spent any time in at all. There were loads of really yummy restaurants and bars within easy walking distance (avoid the mall though!). The port area seemed quaint and festive, and much slower paced and less crowded than the hustle and bustle of Times Square. We are walkers, and found that Canal Street, ferry to Liberty/Ellis, little Italy and 2 subway stops all easily accessible by foot. We felt that we combined 2 vacations in one by staying in this waterfront neighbourhood. Although a winter stay may not be as pleasurable, this would be a great base for a summer visit.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel, smallish room, but decent value”
Reviews.Author: jwb-oregon
Reviews.Content: Not a lot of frills at this place. Stayed there primarily due to location. Room not large, but was clean, although they use some sort of deodorizer (for the carpet, I think) that has a perfumy aroma. Comfortable bed. Loud HVAC on the roof of the neighboring post office was right next to our window. Free breakfast was decent.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, clean hotel for NYC with 'OK' service”
Reviews.Author: jennyjtourofEU
Reviews.Content: We made our reservation directly with the hotel over a month before our trip as we were bringing our relatives from Italy for a 'tour' of America. We had 3 women staying in one room, our uncle in another room and my husband and I in the 3rd room. When we checked in, even though I specifically requested one room had to have 2 double beds, they still gave us 3 rooms with king beds. When I asked them to change the room, they told me they were sold out that night and could possibly change the room the following night. In the meantime, we asked for a rollaway bed, as we were leaving for dinner and wanted to have it ready when we returned. When we returned 3 hours later, the rollaway bed still had not arrived so we asked him to bring it up immediately. He said he would but when he finally arrived with the bed (about half an hour later), my relatives were already changed and in bed and asked he leave the bed outside. We had just flown in that day from Italy and were exhausted. The staff seems very laid back...not at all the Hilton standard that we are used to receiving at other Hilton chains. On the plus side, it was the cheapest hotel we could find in Manhattan with a good location (just a short walk from the train station), quiet area, clean hotel, super comfy beds and breakfast was included. Breakfast was actually very good and the customer service improved greatly over the stay. Perhaps because our family seemed happy sleeping 3 to a bed and so we didn't need to change rooms (not that they were beating down our door to try and help us with the situation). But overall, it was a good experience, despite the initial bad first impression.

Reviews.Title: “Room 105 should be a storage room”
Reviews.Author: tinybabyrobot
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived, we got room 105. We asked for a higher room, but they said they had none available. Room 105 was literally 10 steps from the reception desk. We could hear the music from the desk. There were cardboard boxes in the hallway stacked up. We went back to the reception desk, telling them that there was no way we'd stay in this room and there must be something else. The man at the desk did not say a word to us, simply looking back through his system, and got us a new key card. Wow. The 2nd room, which was on the 2nd floor, was not much better but not nearly as awful as the one downstairs. Would never recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: MGrantB
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business in April. Requested a room on a high floor, and was put on the 2nd. The rooms, while a decent size for NYC standards. are furnished with dated furniture and very poorly lit. My coworker was initially put in a room that smelled like standing water. The one elevator us slow, and the staff hit-and-miss. The location is nice and the breakfast the usual and solid Hilton fare, but until this hotel renovates, you can likely do better for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay in New York”
Reviews.Author: wheretonextOxford
Reviews.Content: good value place to stay within 10 min walk of 2 subway stations giving excellent access to most of the city. 10 min walk to Brooklyn Bridge with views from some rooms of this icon. Room was of expected good standard- great shower and really comfortable bed. Staff excellent, helpful, friendly and professional. Breakfast is included which is a real bonus- good selection which I would think would suit everyone. Would definitely stay again and recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Jenniferstarfish
Reviews.Content: Just got back yesterday from a 3 night stay at this Hampton Inn. The accomodations were roomy for NYC. The staff were the most helpful and courteous that I have ever encountered. They made a very positive impression on my whole family. This is a safe,quieter section of town with the seaport and pier 17 right around the corner. Also this hotel is near the foot of the Brookly Bridge, so you can walk over it and have some pizza at Grimaldi's (the best ever). I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in quiet area of city”
Reviews.Author: ninanancy
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very helpful and really personable. The hotel was a little bit of a walk to the subway, but we found this hotel to be in a quiet part of the city. We wanted to be close to everything, but not have to stay in a loud crowded area. The breakfast was good, the rooms were big and clean. We were very close to the pier and Brooklyn Bridge. It turned out to be a good location for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at underrated location!”
Reviews.Author: thedanishtravellers
Reviews.Content: Seaport is a really nice location, ver underrated. We always stay at midtown and will certainly return here instead. Just a short subway ride away, and the Hampton is just great. Good breakfast, very friendly staff at (for NY) pretty reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “A Hampton Inn in miniature”
Reviews.Author: beulahrit
Reviews.Content: This isn't a standard Hampton Inn. It's New York style with tiny rooms, small breakfast area, and narrow, dark hallways. I was there for business and disappointed with the small, cramped room. However, it's in a great location near the Brooklyn Bridge and the Seaport (shopping and restaurants), convenient to financial district, Federal Plaza, and federal court. I often travel to this area for work and would not choose this hotel again if there were another alternative, though.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, and wonderful people that really assisted with everything.”
Reviews.Author: 60970Trish
Reviews.Content: We were actually visting because we were looking at Colleges, and since we were there we did some site seeing as well. The Hotel personal were so great, with directions and the best way to get around town. Since we were women and one young man, they even gave us a business card in case we got lost so we could call. The attention to details were great. Anyone traveling to New York City I would suggest you stay there. It's location is wonderful and in walking distance to so many things. We are going back in January and I'm looking forward to going back to the same Hotel. Thanks so much for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff doesn't care”
Reviews.Author: jimlam
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was nice and clean, but I had no hot water during my stay! When you spend hundreds of dollars a night, the least you could ask for is hot water for your showers! The worst part of it all was that the staff just didn't care. They barely offered a half-hearted and barely comprehensible apology and didn't even attempt to do anything to correct the problem. While this was probably a one-time event, the lack of service is indicative of their overall attitude to their guests. I stay at Hilton hotels a lot for business and I will probably NEVER stay at this one again.

Reviews.Title: “Small is beautiful”
Reviews.Author: GerhardLink
Reviews.Content: It's a nice,small hotel in downtown NYC,staff is helpful and frindly, hot breakfast is complimentary and absolutely ok. Room was clean and beds comfortable,in the bathroom were all the necessary amenities.Only disadvantage is,that there is limited space for your belongings in the room(but enough for a week). Nearby there are many Shops(South Street Seaport)Pubs(i.e. Heartland Brewery) and Restaurants,in walking distance Ground Zero,Battery Park and Wall Street. TKTS South Street Seaport Booth sells tickets to evening Brodway(and off) performances on the day of the performance, and matinee tickets the day before. Located pretty far away from the "hot spot" times square,but easy to reach by subway (2 or 3 are the best options) or if you have time take the bus M 16,there is a bus stop in front of the hotel. Conclusion:next time being in NYC,we will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Mischa-Mi
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights at this hotel, wer got a great rate at $84 per night. Staff were friendly and very helpful, Rooms were clean although maybe a little small. We had a room at the back of the hotel so our view wasnt the best but the we were only in the hotel to sleep. Breakfast is included in the price. It was noce to start the day with a bowl of fruit, yoghurt and a hot drink. The hotel has free wifi which is excellent i was able to keep up to datewith work emails at no extra expense. The are around the hotel isquiet woth notalot to do in the evenings but is a ten minute walk from the subway station and china town. where there are lots to do. i would reccommend this hotel to anyone visiting new york on a budget and will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: StrictView
Reviews.Content: A hotel basically right on South Street Seaport!!! Can't get much better than that in NYC! Close to the water, shopping, sights, great food...not to mention the nautical themed rooms...super cute! They even supply good quality toiletries...see the pics & go!

Reviews.Title: “South Street Seaport Success!”
Reviews.Author: luckik30
Reviews.Content: Looks can be deceiving, this super small hotel has quite an appeal. Spotless and wonderful on the one hand, but much is to be desired in regards to the service on the other hand. Its a hit-or-miss depending on who is at the front desk unfortunately. Our room had a balcony which was quite nice and offered a great view of the seaport and the Brooklyn Bridge. Even though the room is small, the layout is nice and two people can move around comfortably. Within walking distance of a few subway stops and great activities at the seaport, this hotel should definitely be on your list if you plan on staying in the city.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: One_amazing
Reviews.Content: Few blocks from Fulton subway station. Really clean, safe place. Nice hot breakfast. Staff was excellent. I read one review about the slow elevator and thought how bad could that be, but it really was slow! I definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mobiuslewis
Reviews.Content: Since the Hampton Inn was the cheapest hotel that I could find in Manhattan during the NYC Marathon weekend, I was worried that this hotel would not live up to the good reviews that I read here, or that the neighborhood would be not-so-hot. I was very pleasantly surprised. The hotel, including lobby, breakfast room, and our room were very clean, and appeared to be newly renovated. The complimentary breakfast was excellent, and included hot items (eggs, gravy, waffles) as well as fruit, yogurt, bagels, and pastries. The breakfast room was a little small/cramped. Our room was small but very clean and comfortable, and the bathroom was spacious and clean. We were on the 6th floor, in the back of the hotel facing the East River. We had a view of the back of another building, so try to get a room on a higher floor if you want a better view. The staff kept our luggage after checkout until we were ready to leave and they got us a car to the airport within 5 minutes. We were able to print out our boarding passes using the lobby computer for no charge - very helpful! The neighborhood, while not exactly vibrant, was fine. There were not many nice bars, restaurants, or shops close by. However, we felt safe walking at night (3 women and a young girl) from the subway station, about 5-10 minutes away at a brisk walk. You could easily walk to Wall Street, Trinity Church, Ground Zero, Fulton Fishmarket, and the Brooklyn Bridge. The closest subway stop is Fulton Street, which is conveniently located on several major subway lines and is a stop for the "express" trains. Pearl Street is busy, and you could catch a cab at any time right outside the door. Overall a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, fun, reasonable”
Reviews.Author: pjfrommass
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the Hampton Inn Seaport on a recent family getaway -- most pleased with the cleanliness, GREAT beds, and no bedbugs! The front desk assured us they have never had a report of bedbugs, and we certainly saw no evidence of any problems. The Seaport was a 5-minute walk away, the subway was 10-15, Battery Park/Statue of Liberty ferry 15-20. Took us 20 minutes by subway to Times Square, 25 to Central Park. Nice continental breakfast with waffles, pre-made omelets, hashbrowns, sausage -- Aura Pena, who ran the breakfast room, was very nice and helpful. All of the staff, from front desk to housekeeping, were extremely friendly. The hotel and rooms were a little small, but the price was much more reasonable than anything else we saw online. Went biking on the Brooklyn Bridge with Blazing Saddles (at the Seaport), got great seats at the Seaport TKTS outlet (minimal lines!), parking across the street for $20 a day -- all in all, a good deal!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the Seaport area”
Reviews.Author: Lafayette1
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with a very friendly staff. The complimentary breakfast was excellent and included hot dishes. This hotel is within easy walking durance to the Brooklyn Bridge, Statue of Liberty, Wall Street and Ground Zero. While waiting for our cab, they offered us coffee and tea. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing southern hospitality and great location”
Reviews.Author: JeanieSG
Reviews.Content: I was so surprised to receive such amazing 'southern hospitality' at a New York hotel. This was my family's first visit to the city and after hours and hours of agonizing research about where to stay, I am thrilled the Hampton Inn in Seaport turned out to be such a great choice! The people were friendly and helpful and even allowed guests to store their bags for a late check out at no extra charge. We were not charged extra for the crib either. I know that is normal for hotels elsewhere, but from what I read, most hotels charged extra for these things in NYC. The location turned out to be great as well--walking distance to WTC, Statue of Liberty, Wall Street and Little Italy. There were several good restaurants with outdoor seating on the docks just five minutes from the hotel. We ate there twice. The hotel was also very quiet. We live on a 600 acre farm in Tennessee and I was worried about noise, but this place was super quiet. The breakfast was delicious and we always had a place to sit down and eat. They also have brown bag breakfast ready to grab for those leaving early or with no time to eat. I cannot say enough good things about our stay! (Just for reference... our four children range from 4-13). Save yourself the headache and reserve your room here!

Reviews.Title: “exceptional service - comfy - great location”
Reviews.Author: beachbaby200
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms for Columbus Day weekend with 4 moms and 4 teens. We had searched long and hard to find a hotel with queen beds instead of doubles. We booked on travelnow.com, which sent me a confirmation and charged my credit card but when we showed up at the hotel, they had no record of ever receiving the booking from travelnow. Needless to say, on a holiday weekend, they had very few rooms left and none had queen beds. The front desk clerk and then the manager asked every person checking in whether they really needed 2 beds or could they take a room with a king, and by 10pm when we got back from our day in the city, they had 2 rooms for us with 2 queens each - perfect for the 8 of us. They went over and above what most would have done. By the time we checked out, they still not had received their payment from travelnow but they never made us feel like there was a problem. The rooms were very clean, beds were comfy, subway was about 5 blocks away. Cab ride to Times Square at night with little traffic was $16. Highly recommend this gem!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place To stay”
Reviews.Author: rtpresident
Reviews.Content: The Hampton was very nice!!!. Close to World Trade Center, Centurytel 21,Statue of Liberty, Wall Street, Little Italy, China Town. All of these places we walked to!! Of course at the end of day we were tired. Don't try to look great, wear comfortable shoes and a ball cap, no ones is looking at you anyway. The beakfast that comes with your hotel is wonderful. This place is really CLEAN!!! NO Bed Bugs!!! We kinda had a hard time finding places to eat, but finally there is a place that is just a couple blocks from your hotel, they have shops and real fun places to eat and reasonable. Hope you enjoy it as much as we did. Don't forget to ride the subway to times square.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: 14beacon
Reviews.Content: Hidden Gem right near the South Street Seaport. - Quickly becoming a fan of the Hampton inn Franchise. Three things makes this place stand out in no particular order. 1. Location 2. Price 3. Staff. This place is literally around the corner from all the Seaport activities and fine dining. Online, they had a ridiculous rate of $200 (weekend rate) - this really made the stay worth it as most other places charge $300 a night and above - Staff was exceptional. Really went out of their way to make sure we were comfortable. Room was nice, but just remember, it's not designed for the average traveler to hang out in the room. Our room was pretty small, but nice and comfortable enough to sleep. Breakfast was also included, but nothing to brag about. - Continental style

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and amenities, but services, forget it!”
Reviews.Author: Frequentraveler008
Reviews.Content: Booked through Hampton Inn official website. Prepaid two nights room/tax via c/c online two weeks before arrival. Checked in hotel and was told my credit card on file did not work. Needed to give them another credit card in order to check in. FD clerk asked me to check with my own c/c company. Called immediately to my c/c company and was told charges did go through. Went back down to FD and told the clerk who said he could not do anything about it and I needed to wait for the manager to fix it. Next morning, went down and again reminded them about my problem and was told manager would come later in the day and would fix it for me. Checked again at FD later in the evening and was told that everything had been taken care of. When I checked out the next day, there was still one night room/tax charge still being billed to my room. Finally, the manager was there and helped took the charge off. The staff there never took their time to help solve my problem. They only needed to make one phone call to their customer support to confirm my prepayment. However, no body seemed to care. My room was not cleaned the second day, and I asked for clean towels and never got any delivered. Never mentioned about the internet access. Needed to call down FD to ask for access code. Breakfast was good, but space is limited, so be prepared to stand and eat, or take your foods back to your room. Great location if you are going to Seaport, but you need to walk a long block to the nearest Subway if you want to explore other parts of the city. Overall, the room is nice and spacious and quiet for NY City hotel. But, don't expect any service from this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel--Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: leslie06
Reviews.Content: This is a clean, well-staffed Hampton Inn, though the rooms are small. That's okay, it's the surrounding neighborhood that is very uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service and room/great neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: DDomin1
Reviews.Content: My 2 daughters and I-ages 52, 30 and 20 stayed here and absolutely loved it. Away from the craziness of Midtown and close to Seaport where there's do much to do, right at the foot of the Brooklyn Bridge. Great local wine bar around the corner (met a great dog named Charlie - who lives nearby w/his"mom" )and a wonderful local restaurant - "cowgirl seahorse" behind us and lots to shop for, places to eat, etc. at the Seaport area! We were so happy to be staying in this area with local residents around us. Hampton had great beds, CLEAN room and just a little something for breakfast to hold you till lunch. 20 or so minute walk to Chinatown and Little Italy and on and on for 18 or so miles to Central Park!! then easy access to subway,bus right outside front door. FANTASTIC and FRIENDLY hotel staff!!! WE LOVED IT!!

Reviews.Title: “hotel and staff worth the trip”
Reviews.Author: sherry548
Reviews.Content: on a three night getaway with my cousin, we stayed at the hampton inn on pearl st--GREAT CHOICE- the hotel was great-upscale beds and linens,hotel was immaculate, front desk was friendly and knowledgeable- especially OMAR--he is an asset to this property

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Great Value, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelMKE
Reviews.Content: Near the lower East side, Wall Street, the Brooklyn Bridge and Brooklyn itself for that matter....while being located in Manhattan. The Hampton Inn New York Seaport has the benefits that come having an extremely hospitable and knowledgeable staff, a great location, clean rooms with great beds! This place is the the hot ticket when you have do NYC with the cost value eqaution in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: xamarshahx
Reviews.Content: I found good prices for this hotel right in NYC. It is near the Southstreet Seaport area. Rooms were clean and staff was friendly. They had a decent breakfast in the morning also (which is free).

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: slp0704
Reviews.Content: We found a great weekend rate at this hotel. We live in NJ and were going to see a show, have dinner and go home. Since the weekend rate here was good, we decided to give it a try. We got a room with a terrace and view of the bridge on the 8th floor. I have stayed in NYC several times in the Midtown area. The room here was better than I expected. It is small but not bad for NY. The staff was very friendly and free breakfast was nice. We went to the Seaport Sunday and it was interesting. It is a few minutes walk to a subway to go out and see other things in the city. The only downside was the elevator motor seemed to make a lot of noise. However, based on the rate, the cleanliness of the room, and the staff, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTraveller75
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a night and was impressed by the comfort of the hotel room which had a plush bed. All staff--from the doorman to the reception to the cleaning staff--were friendly. Breakfast (though no-frills) was complimentary, another plus point.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the second time!”
Reviews.Author: NomadForLife
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying here since August 2009 and I was, again, very satisfied. Stayed one night with a friend. Booked room directly through Hilton (I never use sites like Expedia, Hotels, etc.). I booked the room initially at $259 but I checked the rates on the site frequently and the night before saw the rate was now $189. So, I applied for the rate change right on the Hilton site and got the room for $189. I wonder how many people are aware you can do this? It is definitely a money saver! The room was on the 7th floor. Honestly, it was of less quality than last time, still clean and sufficient, don't get me wrong, but it was definitely smaller and the view was of the roof. I think last time we were on a higher floor, maybe 15 (if it goes that high?) But again, there was nothing wrong with the room itself, the staff is so great, friendly and accommodating, I'm sure they would have given us a "better" room if we cared to complain, but it really wasn't a big deal just to sleep. Just want to let people know, the higher rooms seem to have the better views if that's what you're looking for. Free breakfast in the morning, great again, coffee, juice, bagels, muffins, fruit, sausages, yogurt.... Easy check-out, free internet in lobby, literally less than 5 minutes from the subway. Can't beat it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bcosmok
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel because we wanted to go to Ellis Island before going on a cruise. The hotel was great and is within walking distance of Battery Park and the Financial District. The staff was very helpful and we left our luggage with them while we went to Ellis Island. The Breakfast was a good start to the day. The room was roomy and very quiet. I would definitely stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “The Best Staff Ever”
Reviews.Author: DoddyMary
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my boyfriend and my 2 little dogs. The Hotel is ok, but the staff is just great, one of the girls at the front desk I think it was one of the managers she loved our dogs, everytime that she saw them she was playing with them and she was always smiling to everybody and helping with anything that you need. There is a really convinient dog park right at the corner. There is a lot to do around I really liked the South Street Seaport. I also enjoy a Sushi restaurant that is was down the block and another restaurant that they recomend to us really cute and good for romantic couples names Table Tales. I really enjoy my room at the cellar I think that they are great with the cute patio so you can sit outside and enjoy the evening in a quite area. I used to take my breakfast there since it was more private. If you are traveling with pets I think is this is the per fect place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value for repeated stays in NY”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynHeightsNana
Reviews.Content: Bad experiences at the Marriott Brooklyn Bridge led me to check the Manhattan side of the bridge. This hotel is a true gem when you want to visit grandkids in Brooklyn regularly. The front desk could not be more helpful, even offering information we hadn't though of asking. The rooms are comfortable, quiet, extremely clean and provide great temperature control. The housekeeping staff was pleasant and responsive. Breakfast included copious quantities of cut up fresh fruit and we had the option of the "business breakfast" to grab & go in a bag.The incredible affordability was a nice extra!! What really made the difference were the people at the front desk. They recognized us and greeted us each time we walked in or out. Unheard of in our 15 years of regular trips to Manhattan and now Brooklyn. It's awesome to walk out and look up at the Brooklyn Bridge 1/2 block away. Easy to catch a cab. The only problem we experienced was taxi drivers who thought we were tourists and tried to jack up the bill by "missing" the exit to the Brooklyn Bridge from the FDR and then pulling out their GPS and asking again for the address. We'll never stay anywhere else as long as this stays with Hampton Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: _PheobeK_
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the evening and had no problem finding the hotel. When you first get there - park around the corner from the hotel - on the street - check in and have them show you where to park. It only cost us $20/day in an underground. The staff were friendly & very helpful. I have to say - I was a little disappointed when the girl handed me our room keys and told me the room was in the 'cellar',however; when we got to the room we were pleasantly surprised...nicely decorated, clean with a king size bed, small, but we had a walk out patio with wrought iron table & chairs. Breakfast was 'ok' - it was enough to get us going for the day, the dining area is small, so you need to have good timing. The area is safe and clean - we walked around at 11:00 pm without a problem at all. The area also has some old cobblestone streets with some amazing restaurants in the surrounding area - all within 2-10 minutes of walking. Excellent location!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value Dowtown”
Reviews.Author: timbudd
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel on a quiet street in the financial district a few blocks from the seaport. The rooms are a little small as most hotels in NYC, however it is always clean and quiet. The free breakfast is outstanding, doorman is great. I have stayed here a few times and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “You don't even need to leave lower Manhattan, there's so much going on here”
Reviews.Author: ut_ryan
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5 day stay here on vacation with my whole family. I have to say, I was a little wary about being in so far south in Manhattan, which I thought would be away from most of the action, but there is a ton to do in this area. We got a vacation package from NewYorkGuest.com which included our hotel stay, ferry ride to the Statue of Liberty and dinner at a local restaurant for one rate, really at a very good price. This was my first time coming to Manhattan and I feel like there is so much to do that one visit is not enough! We spend a day at the Seaport, browsing the shops and watching the entertainers, then dinner on the water at night. Wall Street was great to explore but nothing too special. Battery Park is beautiful and the whole Canal Street neighborhood is great for shopping! When we booked we were assigned a personal trip advisor (named Jana), which turned out to be really helpful in helping us chose activities on a budget. This hotel is great and in a cheap location, I would recommend it for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for Manhattan!”
Reviews.Author: shlevine
Reviews.Content: I had meetings at Pace University, and this was the closest Hilton family property. I was afraid of what I'd find when I booked a rate of $122 for a Sunday night, which is technically a business night. Granted, it was also superbowl evening, so there may have been fewer bookings in general. Anyway, after the typical harrowing ride from LGA, I was pretty pleasantly surprised. The hotel is pretty new, and the front desk guy was nice and helpful. Per the Manhattan norm, everything is small--lobby, front desk, lone elevator, hallways. Surprisingly, however, the room was pretty spacious, and the bathroom was just fine by NYC standards. The room offered normal Hampton bedding (ok, not great), a small desk, decent desk chair, great desk lamp, separate closet, and a flat screen TV mounted on the wall. Nothing fancy, but then again, it's a Hampton Inn. The hotel IS loud (below my window was, it seemed, a bus depot and bulldozer terminal), but the HVAC drowned out the noise well enough to sleep. The free breakfast was typical Hampton--fine, unpretentious--though the eating area was tee-niny. The area is pretty dead at night, but there were at least five restaurants open w/in a two block radius. Stellas was great. Oh, there's a v-e-r-y sparse, small workout room in the basement, but it was good enough for 30 minutes of cardio. All in all, for less than $150 in Manhattan, this is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Severely Overrated”
Reviews.Author: SheDiz
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel and waited 15 minutes for the front desk clerk to get off of the phone. I was patient, but that didn't seem to matter. He did ask if I was staying for business or pleasure, and I responded business. He then put me in room 103, which is literally in the basement. They call it the cellar, I call it lame. I did ask to be moved, but the guy at the front desk said there wasn't anything available until the next morning. So a little about the cellar - You can hear the ice machine running most of the night, you hear anyone purchasing from the vending machines, and you hear the cleaning people early in the morning. In addition, the person that sets-up the breakfast station for the morning crowd has to come down there to get ice, which sounds like a handful of quarters in a dryer - this happened around 4:30 or 5 a.m. In addition to the creep factor of staying in the basement and all of the noise, when I went to use my hairdryer in the morning, it was broken. I did call the front desk to ask for another, to which they replied, "We don't have portable hairdryers." At this point, I'd really had enough and asked for another room. They did give me another room, and I moved my stuff to the 9th floor. It seemed odd to me that a room was available at 8 a.m., but not the night before. So I didn't really believe the guy at the front desk from the night before. The new room had a lovely view, but it was definitely a smoker’s room, and had a stale smoke smell. The room was fine, and the morning staff was far more helpful. I wouldn't recommend staying in the Cellar, although the one redeeming quality was that it had a small patio. Unfortunately, when I was there it was about 17 degrees outside, and it was completely unusable. I’m not 100% sure why the guy who checked me in asked if I was there for business or pleasure, because he gave me the noisiest room in the place. I walked away believing he was simply a jerk. There are a lot of hotels in New York, and I’m stumped as to why this one gets such high marks. It makes leery of the reviews that people write, and I would recommend spending some time searching around before settling for this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Exoerience”
Reviews.Author: mlisimur
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night on business. The room I had was on the 8th floor. It was clean and well appointed. The staff was excellent and offered to assist me before I had the chance to ask. Also, the breakfast buffet was more than adequate with a nice assortment of baked items, juices, yogurts, cereals, coffee, tea, and fruits. I would absolutely chose to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “OK but unremarkable”
Reviews.Author: DougCG
Reviews.Content: I chose the Hampton Inn Seaport/Financial District based on location. It's convenient- within walking distance of everything in the Financial District- but a little on the far side from a subway stop and on a street that seems a little iffy at night. I was very unimpressed with the room I was given initially- on the first floor, about 10 feet from the check-in desk and right next to the elevator. I asked for, and was given, a new room, but given what I was paying for the room (business trip), I shouldn't have been put in such an awful room initially. The second room they gave me was adequate. Very small, poorly lit, view of an alley, but clean. Staff was less than impressive- not unpleasant, but slow and unable to help with some basic requests. Overall, OK but unremarkable. I would not stay here again if I was able to get another hotel anywhere in the Financial District, but I wouldn't avoid it (i.e, stay in midtown instead) if it was the only option available in the area. Just beware of overpaying for this place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Vasari2003
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor and I am so glad that I did. My husband and I spent a night here last weekend for our anniversary. We got a great rate and I couldn't have been happier with the hotel. I have lived near NYC all my life and worked there for about 8 years, so I am familiar with the city and the prices, and I have to say this was a great deal for the money - especially compared to the overpriced mid-town hotels. First of all, the service was amazing - everyone was so friendly and helpful. So much so that the place really had a small hotel or inn feeling about it. Parking was super convenient and inexpensive for Manhattan. The location was wonderful - nice neighborhood, a couple blocks from the Seaport and a couple blocks from the subway. And it is convenient walking distance from anything downtown - Seaport, Battery Park (Statue of Liberty Ferry), Ground Zero, Little Italy, China Town, etc. We had a room on the 8th floor. The room was small (typical NYC) but very nicely decorated - everything looked updated - and immaculately clean. We had a small balcony off our room from which we could see the tall ships in the Seaport and part of the Brooklyn Bridge. Nice bathroom amenities, flat screen TV in the bedroom, beautiful linens on the bed, wireless internet access. The hotel also has a complimentary breakfast each morning which was very nice and 24 hour coffee service. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Functional, not fancy”
Reviews.Author: Westportia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hampton Inn Seaport on business, because it was the closest hotel to the financial district I could get...with 2 month's notice! I had no trouble catching a cab in the morning. Including taxes, I paid over $500 for one night, and that was the AAA rate. This is supply and demand at work, I suppose. I gave it 3 stars because it was no way worth $500 a night. I was a little afraid when I saw the front of the building--completely nondescript. Having said that, I arrived late at night, and my room was ready and the front desk was very efficient. My bed was very comfortable, the flatscreen tv was great, and the bathroom was spotless and well stocked. The free breakfast was absolutely fine for me--great coffee, cold cereal, baked goods, yogurts, fresh fruit. SO, if you can get a good rate (which, based on the other reviews, seems to be available on the weekends and during nonpeak times), I wouldn't hesitate to stay here, if you don't mind having downtown as your home base.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel - Good Value”
Reviews.Author: BrlDsguise
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Labor Day weekend - couldn't beat the price of $180 per night through their website for a decent NYC hotel. Upon arrival was given a room on the "C" level which involved taking an elevator down one flight from the ground floor lobby. Although this room had a coutyard patio we found it dark and kind of creepy so they moved us to the lobby level which was a little better. Friendly staff, nice lobby and good breakfast. Room was fairly large for NYC standards but very drab color scheme. Very convenient to South Street Seaport and a short walk to the subway. Would not be my first choice in the area but would stay again if the room had the same value.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 4biegeglboys
Reviews.Content: After searching for a decent priced hotel in New York City we came across this one. It got nothing but good reviews when I read about it so we decided to give it a try. I am so glad we did. What a nice hotel! Only about a 5 minute walk to 2 different subway stations and about a 15 minute walk to the Staten Island Ferry. We wished we could've stayed longer (we only came into town for one night for a Mets game). The free breakfast food was also nice since we were coming here on a tight budget. Our first visit to NYC was very good and I cannot wait to come back. We will definately come back here. Only one problem, we wanted to take our bed home with us. It was the most comforable bed I've slept in in a long time!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent NYC bargain”
Reviews.Author: Trish0928
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn Seaport during our tenth anniversary weekend. I'd booked it through hilton.com and got an outrageously good rate, $171/night (thanks to my husband being considered elderly we got the AARP discount), which is practically unheard of for a decent Manhattan hotel. The staff, as many have mentioned before, are outstanding. We had a room on the eighth floor. Since it 's New York the room was small but it was clean and nicely decorated, a deep-blue wall giving it a boutique look. The bathroom, also small, still had a marble counter and floor and the shower was more than adequate. The room was quiet, the beds comfortable and the climate control was good. The hotel is adjacent to the South Street Seaport and the Fulton/Nassau Street subway stop is maybe a ten-minute walk. The neighborhood is relatively decent so don't worry about coming back at night. The free internet worked fine (although if you're off it for any length of time you have to log back in). The free breakfast was meh, but it was free. If you're looking for luxury surroundings go uptown, but for a place to crash you're not going to do much better than here.

Reviews.Title: “couldn't beat the price”
Reviews.Author: bojette
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights (Sun/Mon) in July while attending Mets and Yankees games. Hotel was exactly what we needed. Couldn't beat the price, $520 for 2 nights. Easy to get to from either the Brooklyn Bridge or the Holland Tunnel. Parking garage across the street. Subway 4 blocks away. Convenient to the Statue of Liberty, South Street Seaport (restaurants), WTC site, and Wall street. As always with the Hampton Inn, breakfast was included. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 452s
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for downtown and the seaport area . You can walk to the bars and restaurants nearby. Also handy for the ferry to Ellis Island and to ground zero. Great shop near ground zero called Century 21 its a bit like TK Max but bigger. The hop on hop off stops just by peir 17 close by. The room was small but very clean. The lobby was small too but the staff where friendly. If you like the buzz of Times Squre this may not be for you, but the weekend rate is very good if you book it through their own website.

Reviews.Title: “So pleased we believed the reports on this site”
Reviews.Author: Roxy-Popsy
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms for 4 nights at the beginning of April & reserved our stay on the hotel website. However, it was working out pricey so rang the hotel direct & they gave us an excellent rate, thank you very much. We had rooms on the 6th floor but I asked to change ours after the first night & the staff were most helpful. A staff member kindly showed me a couple of rooms which were not acceptable to me. They said that as long as the occupiers of a room on the top floor didn't extend their stay we could change to this room. It had a queen bed not a king but this was fine by us.The folks left their room, we packed up our belongings & the staff moved our suitcase on our behalf, again thank you very much. The room was perfect & had great views, a bonus which was really appreciated, again thank you. The breakfasts were upto the fresh, plentiful & varied standard that we have come to expect from the Hampton chain. The breakfast seating area isn't that big as has been reported previously but enough room for everyone each morning that we were there. The bedrooms & bathrooms were SPOTLESS & beds so comfortable which is another reason we stay at the Hampton chain. One evening we were too tired to eat out & the concierge gave us a take-out menu for a nearby pizza place. It was delivered on time & was hot, tasty & very good value. We asked various questions re local info etc of the staff & the replies were always useful, helpful & delivered in a professional yet friendly manner, as though they were pleased we wanted to stay at their hotel. A special 'thank you' to Marcos for all his assistance. The free use of internet (another reason we stay at Hampton Inns) was useful to check-in online for our return flights home. It's located near the front entrance so no real privacy but this didn't matter on this ocassion. The only downside was when we booked a car, via the front desk, to take us back to JFK. We thought that this would be advisable as we didn't know if any cabs would take us becasue a lot of the cab drivers change shift at 4pm & we booked our cab for 3.30pm. The car arrived promptly but when we shut all the car doors it reeked of smoke. The driver then spent more than a third of the journey on his cell phone. I wouldn't book a car again as lots of cabs were going past & I'm sure we would have found one to take us to JFK. I did report this back to the hotel but I didn't have a reply. This area is fantastic to enjoy the sights, shopping, views & brooklyn bridge area. Our adult daughters loved it, especially the shopping in the Seaport mall & Abercrombie & Fitch nearby, very, very nearby! Access to all areas of NY was easy by subway & we really enjoyed being able to walk to the ferry & enjoy a ride.. it's free!! There is also a free Seaport area bus that stops at various areas in the Seaport district if you don't want to walk. We can't wait to return to NY & stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rkaradi
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to staying at this hotel because of all the positive reviews, and after staying here for two nights this month, I will never stay again. First off, I must say the hotel is very clean and the staff incredibly friendly. My wife and I got there at around noon and were told my assigned room was not ready yet, and in fact the people hadn’t checked out yet (this was not a big deal to me since check in was 3 PM and I was just hoping to get a room earlier). They said if we wanted a room now, we could get one on the main hotel floor otherwise wait till check in. Since we had flown in on a red eye from San Francisco we opted for the room available now. Needless to say it was the smallest room I have ever stayed in, even for New York standards it seemed small, the door to the room almost touched the bed. We were about 50 feet from the check in desk and it was just plain noisy at all hours of the day. We were woken up by lobby nose both nights from arriving guests between midnight and 3 am several times (it seemed like people coming home from parties or a late night) who didn’t realize people might actually be sleeping. It was downright ridiculous. I would have changed rooms after the first night, but because we were there for only 2 nights it was too much of a hassle. Also the room had a window that looked onto the balcony of two other rooms, and there were no privacy curtains, just drapes. So you had no choice but to close the curtains if you wanted privacy. I’m use to most hotels having sheers and then curtains, but not this room, so basically we had to keep the drapes closed at all times. Also there were only 3 outlets available in the whole room. Two in the bathroom and one at the desk, all others were used and behind furniture. So trying to charge two computers and cell phones was nearly impossible, plus you had to work at the desk if you needed to plug in. For a newer hotel and a Hampton I was very surprised at the lack of plugs. My main issue was the noise; I imagine if we were on a different floor, I would have been happier. The only other issue was that there was not much to do in the general area. If you’re in town to sightsee, or to do tourist stuff, I would recommend a hotel in a different neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in the middle of the big apple”
Reviews.Author: 007DAWG
Reviews.Content: It a small hotel on the Manhattan side of the brooklyn bridge that is good for a business or pleasure traveler. Standard Hampton morning breakfast, helpful staff, but very small rooms, so if you are trying to fit more than 2 people in the room, it might be cramped. Walking distance to most lower manhattan toruist sites, and the deli around the corner is very good. Nothing fancy, just gets the job done.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in nice quet NYC area”
Reviews.Author: ywi
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in quite a few Hampton Inns and this is a nice one too. The breakfast was good but the area somewhat small, the room was nice and clean but just ok for a family of 4. The location was great with views of Brooklyn Bridge - make sure to get a street view on either 7 or 8 floor and you can see the bridge. Walking distance to Pier 17, the downtown helicopters, Ground Zero and the subway stations.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Portia1972
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights and have to say it was fantastic. The rooms to NY size are comaprable, the bed was very comformtable and the decor stylish/modern. The service staff at the front desk made all the diffrence. They were attentive and also let me stay on an additional hour after check in without a great deal of fuss. The hotel offers free breakfast in the room rate and free wireless internet. Both services used and were handy. The hotel is walking distance to Seaport Pier, 10 minutes to China town and 15 mins to SOHO. I recommend this property and would most certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: time2gotravel
Reviews.Content: Usually when hotels show great photos on a website, but you get there and it doesnt look any where near as nice....... Well, not this Hampton...It was so beautiful and looked just like it did in the photos. The Front desk staff (carlos Mostly and Jonathan is who i spoke with) were amazing....so friendly and Helpful! The room was spotless. Great view! 10 minute walk to Chinatown, 5 minute walk to the Seaport, restaurants and shopping, also a quick 12 minute walk to the financial district and the Huge discount shopping store on Trinity place/cortlandt called Century 21! Fulton st. subway is right there so you can take a quick 15 minute subway trip uptown to the garment district, penn station and madison sq. garden. You will love this hotel! I found it on my website www.time2gotravel.org Heather/travel agent The photo of the room i took with my camera phone

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderul Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: mrqewd15
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hampton Inn Manhattan/Seaport/Financial District from March 23-28 and had a wonderful experience. The hotel is clean and the staff gives excellent service. My room was cleaned everyday and I had a spectacular view of Brooklyn, Brooklyn Bridge and the Seaport. Breakfast was served every morning which was very convenient for me considering I stayed there for business and did not have a lot of time in the morning to stop and get something to eat outside of the hotel. The doorman gave me precise directions to get anywhere I wanted to go. It was a pleasure staying at this hotel and I would certainly stay there again. The only thing that I did not like is that if you use the Fulton/Williams Subway station near the hotel during the day time, then don’t always expect for it to be open late night after 12:00 midnight. The station was usually closed late night for maintenance during my stay or I would need to make a transfer to another train because the trains are rerouted after midnight from this station. I would have to find an alternate route or catch a taxi back to the hotel. This was not really a problem at all it’s just that I had to walk a few extra blocks by using another station. The fitness room is small and only has one treadmill so I had to wait until the person using it was done. They also have a spin bike as well. The hotel is 3 blocks from the Seaport for shopping and fun. But if you are looking for a clean hotel with comfortable beds, excellent service and breakfast with a smile then I highly recommend this hotel. I can’t wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: gabsterUK
Reviews.Content: Hotel is close to the Brooklyn Bridge and the Seaport in lower east area of Manhattan. I stayed for a long weekend in March 2008. Hotel is small, modern, well presented and very clean. The staff could not do enough to help - they were wonderfull. Room was a bit cramped but typical for New York. Bathroom was reasonably spacious and well equipped. (inc toiletries) Room had coffee making facilities, desk with internet connection, TV (no pay movies), iron and board, clock/radio alarm. Bed was extremely comfortable! Clean and functional with no frills. Breakfast was free., again, not a Hilton spread but perfectly OK. Breakfast room would get busy and i would have to wait a few minutes for a table ~ only slight criticism. Location suited me. The area is reasonably quiet at night! There are plenty of restaurants close by including the excellent Bridge Cafe ~ lovely food! Comfortable walking distance to Ground Zero, Ellis Island ferries and the 'trendy' districts of Little Italy, China Town etc. Nearest tube stations are a 5 minute walk and will both take you to almost anywhere. Taxi to Times Square was only about $12. Ask concierge to arrange a car to the airport rather than get a yellow cab. A little gem of a hotel if you just want a 'base' and don't want to be pampered. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great lower manhattan location”
Reviews.Author: enaj47
Reviews.Content: great location for all of lower manhattan: chinatown, wall street, lower east side, seaport. Efficient check-in, parking across the street, clean room, large bathroom. Good free breakfast and tasty cookies in the evening. we booked an AAA rate for 135 a night each for 2 rooms. FOR MANHATTAN? This is worth the money .

Reviews.Title: “clean and wonderful in manhattan”
Reviews.Author: melissalenahan
Reviews.Content: ***Great Rates ($135.00/night/wknds incl.) With AAA and Hampton Reward club. Wonderful hotel. Built in 2006, brand new rooms and facilities. Stylish and warm. Wonderful staff. Great continental breakfast. Eggs, Bagles, Biscuits, Toast, 3Kinds of Cereal, Orange, Cranberry, Apple, Coffee, Yougurt, Fresh fruit and very fresh. Pictures posted speak for themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: babs61954
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton last weekend for a "girls get-away". We arrived before check-in and called the hotel for directions as we had gotten lost. The hotel staff was wonderful and gave us landmarks which made it easier to find the hotel. We were able to check in early and leave our luggage in the room. Parking was conveniently located across the street. The room was extremely clean and the beds were very comfortable. After checking out in the morning, we were able to leave our luggage in a locked area off the lobby while we toured the city further. We will definitely come back for another trip soon!!!.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Little Hotel in Lower Manhattan!”
Reviews.Author: Surbs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this delightful little hotel (a real find in NYC in our view) during Christmas week of '07 (just last week!) and would return here in a heartbeat. While the rooms and closets are definitely small, this being NY after all, the hotel itself is an excellent value for the city. The beds are extremely comfortable and the bathroom is quite large, and always well-stocked. There is free internet connection in the room, and a flat-screen TV on the wall, and local calls are all free. Every business day there is free delivery of both the Wall Street Journal and USA Today! The breakfast buffet is quite okay, though my wife being vegetarian would have welcomed some hot meal options for her. Every day there are two hot meal choices, usually sausages and eggs, but otherwise the bar is well stocked with fruit juices, bagels, bread, fruit, cereal, and tea, coffee and hot chocolate is availabel 24 hours a day! The hotel is also in a safe neighborhood adjacent to the South Street Seaport and about a 5 minute walk from the subways, both the A train that connects to JFK thru the Air Train and the cross-town 1,2,3 trains for the rest of Manhattan. We walked the streets quite safely even after 10pm at night, and returned home after 1am on New Year's Eve, and it was quite safe. Within walking distance is the Financial District, Battery Park, and Ground Zero, and the rest of Manhattan in minutes thru subways. The staff at the hotel is excellent, from room service to the doormen and front desk, especially Jackie who checked us in very efficiently and with a welcoming smile, and made sure our entire 8 day stay was well taken care of!

Reviews.Title: “Not cozy or romantic, but problem free and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: timbuk2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for the final 2 nights of my trip. Upon reflection, there was nothing special or unique about this hotel and I know I wont really think back on my stay here or remember it down the road. There was no nice view. No pay-movies. No restaurant or bar. The room was small and clean. It didn't look as slick as the pictures on the website, but it was pretty close. On the flip side, there was a complimentary water waiting for me when I first arrived to the room, there was complimentary breakfast available in the morning, and there was pleasant and professional staff working at all times of the day. So although there really isn't much I'll remember about this hotel, this might just be a very good thing to some folks. Contrary to some people's opinions, we did not find this hotel convenient for the subway. We had to walk for 15 minutes to get to a subway, and 25 minutes in the evenings. This hotel is near the South Street Seaport which is fun in the day, but in the evening this area pretty much shuts down. Would I stay here again? Yes, but only by myself or for business. I would not recommend this hotel for families or for those looking for a romantic or relaxing place.

Reviews.Title: “Typical NYC Hotel - Small Room, Convenient Location, Scandalous Price”
Reviews.Author: TomMQuinn
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times now, all trips being for business purposes. As my business is in the seaport district, the location is convenient. Just two blocks from the office and the seaport with its shops and restaurants. The rooms are nice but small - typical of the city - don't be expecting to have much room to walk around your bed, and the closet is tiny. Ask for one of the rooms which has a terrace on the top floor - at least then you can walk out and look over the seaport. Internet connectivity is free, which is good. The breakast is not too bad considering it is free, and you would pay $10 at Cafe Europa just down the street. The main issue is the price - this hotel anywhere else in the US would probably be $149 max per night. I paid $650 per night in December. Ouch.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Revfan
Reviews.Content: Booked at the Hampton Inn because I needed to travel to NY for business and there was NOTHING else available. I've been told the first week of December is not a good time to come to the city on business because hotels are sky high (this property was $521, which was about a $100 per hour of sleep and about $350 more than I would expect to pay). I've stayed in the area but never at this hotel. At that rate you'd normally expect luxury, but this week all of the hotels were equally expensive and many had no availability at all. The Hampton Inn offered warm cookies on check in, a clean room with a comfortable bed, and a clean bathroom. The sheets were a bit scratchy but clean, and the bed was comfortable. The flat screen tv saves space in the small room. In the morning, there was a free warm (not quite hot) and continental breakfast available, with "grab & go" bags if you're on the run. The "fitness center" consists of one treadmill and one bike, so if you're expecting a workout, stay elsewhere. I did not find the area noisy...in fact it's a bit deserted, but there are a few restaurants around and the Metro is very close. One downside was a colleague was shut out of the hotel due to "maintenance" on his room (read: oversold) but the hotel, to its credit, gave him a voucher to stay at the Express, not far away. Also, a couple of the rooms are actually on the basement level, so beware. Nonetheless, I would stay at this hotel again. It was a short walk to the financial district.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, noisy & not the best location”
Reviews.Author: ohbuddy18
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Inn in the Financial District is a newer property and features very comfortable rooms, nice bedding/linens, flat screen TV's mounted on the wall, and nice bathrooms. As far as Hampton Inn's go, this is a very nice property. The Service was excellent. There is a doorman, whose name escapes me, who was very helpful and had very good local insight. He gave us detailed directions to everywhere we wanted to go. The front desk staff and everyone else was very nice. The only negative was that the way the rooms were situated was such that all room doors on a floor opened into a common area - there was no hallway. So, if people are going out for a nightcap at 1,2,3am, you can easily hear slamming doors, cell phone conversations, etc...this is more of a "heads up" not a reason not to stay here at all. Also, the location was good for history buffs (wall St., financial area, 9/11 memorial area, south street seaport) but we didn't really find a whole lot to do within a short walk from the hotel. There were 2 subway stops close by, and both were easy to get to and made transport into mid/upper Manhattan easy. Just know that you're going to have to ride the subway or take a cab to get anywhere other than the few blocks around your hotel (chinatown/little Italy is about a mile walk - not TOO bad...) If you're OK with that, this hotel is an excellent and affordable choice (we paid $179/night over Thanksgiving weekend!) I fully recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Can't understand how it is rated so highly”
Reviews.Author: BuffaloNYTraveler
Reviews.Content: I can't understand how this hotel is rated #18 out of 300+ hotels. It is a very small hotel, literally just 4 windows across, in a historic building and the rooms are strategically situated to accommodate only 8 rooms per floor. The room was very small even for NYC standards. Though relatively clean, the room was dark and dreary, drapes faded and stained and stains of some kind over the bathroom door. The quilt on the bed smelled as if it had not been laundered in a long time. With only one elevator, the cleaning staff needs to use it to move dirty laundry and trash along with the visitors. Not a pleasant experience. At one point, they shut down the elevator for their use. You need to be able to use stairs. Would not stay here again. On the up side, the staff is friendly and helpful. If you validate your parking for the ramp across the street it is only $20 a day which is really cheap for NTC.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SimonHunter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only one night whilst travelling in New York and I really wish we’d stayed longer! The hotel was very clean and had extremely comfy beds with plenty of room to get unpacked. The facilities were excellent, with a flat screen TV, coffee machine, ironing board and a very clean and well presented bathroom. The hotel staff were very friendly and made us feel really welcome. The breakfast the following day was just what we wanted and once again the staff were very helpful. The location is great and there are some really nice shops, bars and cafes close by. I suggest a burger in Nelsons across the rd (Kiwi bar) and a coffee from Jakes around the corner. Only problem would be that breakfast was server on plastic plates (perhaps they had a problem that day), but dont let that put you off the hotel is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “What a great find.”
Reviews.Author: CoffeemonsterUk
